title: Vintage Dom Perignon Champagne Label FONT ID
content:
I'm looking for a font id for the "Dom Perignon" cursive. This obviously looks hand-drawn, but does anybody know of a cursive font that has a similar look and feel?

Thanks,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330im_/http:/typophile.com/files/-1_5094.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/typophile.com/files/-1_0.jpg) | 28.93 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
Hi Danny,

this style is called ‘ [Ronde](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/new.myfonts.com/tags/ronde)’. Some typefaces from this genre:  
 [Gando aka French 111](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/french-111/)  
 [Linoscript aka Typo Upright aka French Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/linoscript/)  
 [ITC Redonda](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/redonda-itc/)  
F

Still a little too light:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atfrench-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atfrench-script/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atfrench-script/")

But with the most similar D.

By the way, French Script was bundled with the free Palm Desktop app (at least with the Mac version).  
 [http://kb.palm.com/wps/portal/kb/common/article/33529\_en.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018235330/http:/kb.palm.com/wps/portal/kb/common/article/33529_en.html "http://kb.palm.com/wps/portal/kb/common/article/33529\_en.html")
